QAPair.Question: What is (are) Nerve conduction velocity ?
QAPair.Answer: Nerve conduction velocity (NCV) is a test to see how fast electrical signals move through a nerve. This test is done along with electromyography (EMG) to assess the muscles for abnormalities.

QAPair.Question: What to do for Nerve conduction velocity ?
QAPair.Answer: An NCV test shows the condition of the best surviving nerve fibers. Therefore, in some cases the results may be normal, even if there is nerve damage.
